intro: Microlicia thymifolia, commonly known as the thyme-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves that resemble those of thyme, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. Microlicia thymifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
